metadata.feature_description: Create, edit, and manage post tags for categorization and filtering

steps.action: Navigate to Post Editor via News page Create Post
steps.expected: Post Editor with Tags section should be visible
steps.actual: Post Editor loaded with Edit Post Details panel containing Tags field with placeholder 'separate tags with a comma'

steps.action: Click on Tags input field and type 'Technology' then press comma
steps.expected: Tag should be added as a visual chip
steps.actual: Tag 'Technology' was added as a blue chip with an x (remove) button

steps.action: Type 'News' and press comma to add second tag
steps.expected: Second tag should appear alongside the first
steps.actual: Both 'Technology' and 'News' tags displayed as blue chips with remove buttons

steps.action: Click the x (remove) button on the 'News' tag chip
steps.actual: The 'News' tag was successfully removed, only 'Technology' tag remains

steps.action: Type a new tag name 'Technology' in the Tags input and press comma
steps.expected: New tag should be created and displayed
steps.actual: New tag 'Technology' was created and displayed as a blue chip

steps.action: Type another new tag 'News' and press comma
steps.expected: Second new tag should be created
steps.actual: Tag 'News' was successfully created and added to the post

steps.action: Type partial tag text 'Tech' in the Tags input field
steps.expected: Auto-suggest dropdown should appear with matching tags
steps.actual: Text 'Tech' was entered but no auto-suggest dropdown appeared. This may be expected behavior as tags are not yet saved to the taxonomy system

steps.action: Type a very long tag name exceeding 50 characters
steps.expected: Input should be limited to 50 characters (maxlength validation)
steps.actual: The input was truncated at 50 characters. Text 'ThisIsAVeryLongTagNameThatExceedsFiftyCharactersLi' was displayed, showing the maxlength=50 validation works correctly

steps.action: With 'Technology' tag already added, type 'Technology' again and press comma
steps.expected: System should prevent duplicate tag or show error indication
steps.actual: The duplicate tag was detected and the input field displayed 'Technology' with a red/pink background indicating the error. The duplicate was not added to the tag list

observations: Auto-suggest feature did not display a dropdown when typing partial tag names. This may be because tags need to exist in the taxonomy system first before suggestions appear, or the feature only works on the tag filter/cloud view rather than the post editor.
The Tags field uses comma as a separator to add tags, as indicated by the placeholder text 'separate tags with a comma'.
The tag input has a maxlength of 50 characters, enforced by HTML attribute validation.
Duplicate tag detection provides visual feedback with a red/pink background highlight on the input field.
